~~~~~ are temporary storage used by instructions and data. E.g. Accumulator, Stack pointer, Instruction pointer, program counter, etc.

Explain why the chair is considered an important piece of equipment when operating a computer. Describe the characteristics of a suitable chair for the computer environment
Questions.Solution: Includes Ergonomics, 5 casters, adjustable lumba & height, cushions

Questions.Question: Describe why warm white lighting is better to use than cool white when working with computers at night.
Questions.Solution: Includes - Blue light harmful to eye cones, stimulates the brain, causes eye strain

Questions.Question: What are the risks associated with ISO propyl alcohol?
Questions.Solution: Includes - dissolves essential body oils, skin irritant, harmful to the CNS, highly flammable

Sections.Title: SECTION E: DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS
Sections.Instruction: Answer all questions within in the space provided.

Questions.Question: In file maintenance, briefly explain what 'defragmentation' is, and why you would NOT defragment the SSD.
Questions.Solution: Include - data placed at random locations. Impacts read latency. designed for spindle drives, SSD does not get fragmented, it is optimized.

Questions.Question: When configuring a workstation for a specific role, explain how “burn-in test” could ensure a successful build.
Questions.Solution: Include - check for stability and ensure no hardware has failed. Checks cooling over time and that the hardware performs as intended under load.

Questions.Question: Describe TWO informational or control aspects of Windows Task Manager which could be useful if you were trying to diagnose degraded performance of a Microsoft Windows workstation?
Questions.Solution: Include any - process count, memory usage, cpu usage, io consumption

Questions.Question: Describe what is meant by benchmarking and the importance if this in regards to computer hardware
Questions.Solution: Include - check for stability and performing at the designed spec of the hardware.

Sections.Title: SECTION F: SECURITY CONCEPTS
Sections.Instruction: : Answer all questions within the space provided. One mark will be given for each correct answer.

Questions.Question: The accepted definition of information security within a government is: ~~~~~ relating to the ~~~~~, availability and ~~~~~ of information'”.
~~~~~: Verifying the identity of a user, device, or entity in a computer system. Common methods include passwords, biometrics, and multi-factor authentication.
~~~~~: Transforming information into a secure format that can only be read by someone with the correct decryption key. This is crucial for protecting data in transit and at rest.
~~~~~: Techniques and software used to prevent, detect, and remove malicious software, such as viruses, worms, and ransomware.
Four primary security attach categories are Access, Modification, ~~~~~ and ~~~~~.
Security countermeasures include ~~~~~ and encryption
~~~~~: The process of identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks to an organization's assets. This includes conducting risk assessments, implementing controls, and monitoring for new threats.
Briefly describe the role of an operating system in the context of computing devices.
Questions.Solution: Include - manages/allocates computer hardware and software resources, and provides common services/API for computer programs

Questions.Question: In terms of the bootstrapping process, correctly expand the POST acronym.
Describe two benefits of PowerShell for the operating system.
Briefly describe a primary benefit of using a 64-bit operating system over a 32-bit operating system.
Questions.Solution: Include any larger applications, access to more memory, faster code

Sections.Title: SECTION H: NETWORKING
Sections.Instruction: Answer all questions within the space provided. One mark will be given for each correct answer

Questions.Question: Network generally considered within the organisation and on a single geographic site.
Definitions of common sets of rules and signals that specify how computers on a network communicate.
Architecture of a network.
TCP/IP software.
Network element used to identify a target network and a specific device within the target network.
Data Link layer and Physical Layer.
Device used to connect one network to another.
A TCP/IP network mechanism used to determine if a device on a network is active.
A secure TCP/IP protocol used with browsers to request resources of an encrypted session.
A measurement indicating the maximum capacity of a network communications connection in a given amount of time.

Question: When working in the Linux terminal, which of the following commands is used to find the appropriate help from the various manual pages?
1. {Command{ --help
1. man {Command}
1. apropos {Command}
1. whatis {Command}
1. All of the above

1. /usr/passwd
1. /home/passwd
1. /etc/passwd
1. /etc/usr/passwd
1. /var/passwd

1. A network switch or router is down
1. You need to restart the networking service
1. The network adapter is turned off
1. A wireless service is down
1. All of the above

1. Process management
1. Resource management
1. User management
1. Memory management
1. All of the above
